AF.notes: Due to safety concerns, the Indonesian government advises its citizens not to visit Afghanistan.

AL.notes:
Visa requirement is waived for used and valid, multiple-entry US, UK or Schengen visa holders.
A maximum of 90 days of stay within 180 days period.

DZ.notes: A maximum of 180 days total stay within a one year period.

AD.notes:
There are no visa requirements for entry into Andorra, but it can only be accessed by passing through France or Spain. A multiple-entry Schengen visa is required to re-enter either France or Spain when leaving Andorra. 
A maximum of 90 days of stay within 180 days period.

AO.notes:
International Certificate of Vaccination required.
Visitors who have been granted an online pre-visa or have requested such pre-visa from the consulates of Angola abroad, are then issued with a visa on arrival at the country's border check points.
For a maximum total stay of 90 days within a one year period.
Besides having printed confirmation that a visa will be issued upon arrival, passengers must: have a return/onward ticket, and have a hotel reservation confirmation.

AG.notes: Visa on arrival may only be obtained for US, UK, Canada or Schengen visa holders, among other requirements.

AR.notes:
A maximum of 90 days of stay per period.
ETA is available for holders of US B2 visa or Schengen C visa (with at least 3 month validity left) at a fee of USD50 and for a stay of up to 90 days.

AU.notes:
A maximum of 90 days of stay per entry.
May apply online (Online Visitor e600 visa).
Transit visa is not required.

AT.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

AZ.notes: eVisa option is also available for Indonesian citizens for maximum stay of 30 days

BS.notes:
A maximum of 90 days of stay per entry.
Visa requirement is waived for the US or Canada Permanent Residents for a maximum stay of 30 days.

BH.notes: Extendable for another 2 weeks by visiting NPRA in Bahrain.

BY.notes: Must arrive and depart via Minsk International Airport and not on flights to and from Russia since these are regarded as internal Union State internal flights with no border controls. Indonesian nationals must also have plane tickets with confirmation of a departure date within 30 days and medical insurance in the amount of at least €10,000.

BE.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

BZ.notes: Visa requirement is waived for multiple-entry US visa holders.

BT.notes: Visas are issued only to tourists booked with a local licensed tour operator.

BO.notes: Authorization is required from the Directorate General of Immigration of Bolivia.

BA.notes: Visa requirement is waived for valid multIple-entry Schengen visa holders, with a maximum of 15 days of stay.

BG.notes: Visa requirement is waived for Romania, Cyprus, Croatia or Schengen visa holders for a maximum of 90 days of stay within 180 days period.

CA.notes: Transit visa is not required if holding a valid US visa and travelling on an approved airline through an approved Canadian airport.

CV.notes:
Obtainable at Nelson Mandela International Airport, Cesária Évora Airport, Amílcar Cabral International Airport and Aristides Pereira International Airport.
Passengers arriving via some countries must hold an International Certificate of Vaccination.

CN.notes: Visa on arrival is available for Indonesian passport holders with specific conditions and at only some ports of entry.

CO.notes: 90 days - can be extended to a maximum of 180 days within a one year period.

CR.notes: Visa requirement is waived for US and Canada visa holders.

HR.notes: Visa requirement is waived for Romania, Cyprus, Bulgaria or Schengen visa holders for a maximum of 90 days of stay within 180 days period.

CY.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

CZ.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

DK.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

EC.notes:
Extendable stay.
A maximum of 60 days of stay in Galapagos under strict conditions.

EG.notes: Pre-approval from Egypt authorities required prior to visa issuance.

GQ.notes: International Certificate of Vaccination required if travelling from a country with risk of yellow fever.

ER.notes:
A maximum of 30 days of stay from the day of arrival.
Extendable at the Immigration Office in Asmara.

EE.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

ET.notes: eVisa holders must arrive via Addis Ababa Bole International Airport

FI.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

FR.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

GA.notes:
Electronic visa holders must arrive via Libreville International Airport.
International Certificate of Vaccination required.

GM.notes:
Must obtain an entry clearance from the Gambian Immigration prior to travel.
International Certificate of Vaccination required.

GE.notes:
A maximum of 30 days of stay within 120 days
Visa requirement is waived for Australia, EU and its territories, Switzerland, UAE, Qatar, Oman, New Zealand, Japan, Israel, Canada, South Korea, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, Liechtenstein, Norway or USA  visa holders.

DE.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

GH.notes:
International Certificate of Vaccination required.
Visa on arrival / Emergency entry visa may be obtained

GR.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

IS.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

IN.notes: e-Visa issued for duration 1 year multiple entry free of charge for Nationals of Indonesia.

IQ.notes: As of July 2014, due to safety concerns, Indonesian government advises its citizens not to visit Iraq.

IE.notes: Visa is issued free of charge.

IL.notes: Entry ban for Indonesian tourists has been lifted

IT.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

JP.notes: Visa not required for 15 days only if biometric passport is endorsed with a Visa Waiver Registration Certificate from a Japanese Embassy or Consulate.

KR.notes:
Visa not required for a maximum stay of 30 days if:
holding a visa issued by Australia, Canada, USA or New Zealand and only if in transit from or to those countries via South Korea.
arriving and departing from Jeju (CJU) for tourism purpose.
having previously entered Korea at least 4 times within the last 2 years or at least 10 visits in total.

KG.notes:
Visa on arrival available at Manas International Airport.
Electronic visa holders must arrive via Manas International Airport or Osh Airport or through land crossings with China (at Irkeshtam and Torugart), Kazakhstan (at Ak-jol, Ak-Tilek, Chaldybar, Chon-Kapka), Tajikistan (at Bor-Dobo, Kulundu, Kyzyl-Bel) and Uzbekistan (at Dostuk).

LB.notes: In addition to a visa, an approval should be obtained from the Immigration department of the General Directorate of General Security (La Surete Generale).

LI.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

LT.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

LU.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

MW.notes: Can extend for a total of 90 days.

MT.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

MR.notes:
Visa on arrival available at Nouakchott–Oumtounsy International Airport.
International Certificate of Vaccination required.

MX.notes: Visa requirement is waived for valid US, Canada, Japan, UK or Schengen visa holders.

NL.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

NO.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

PK.notes:
Electronic Travel Authorization to obtain a visa on arrival for tourism purposes.
Electronic Travel Authorization to obtain a visa on arrival for business purposes.
Online Visa eligible.

PA.notes: Visa requirement is waived for multiple-entry, one year valid USA, Australia, Canada or UK visa holders. Schengen visa holders are also included in this category.

PL.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

PT.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

RO.notes: Visa requirement is waived for multiple-entry Bulgaria, Cyprus, Croatia or Schengen visa holders.

RU.notes: 72-hour visa-free visit to St Petersburg, if travelling using St. Peter Line.

SM.notes: Only accessible via Italy, therefore a Schengen visa is required,

SK.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

SI.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

ES.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

SR.notes:
Single entry tourist card valid for up to 90 days may be obtained online, on arrival at the airport or in any Surinamese representation abroad.
Multiple entry eVisa is also avaible.

SE.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

CH.notes: A maximum of 90 days of stay within a 180 day period in the Schengen Area.

TJ.notes: E-visa holders can enter through all border points.

TL.notes: Indonesian citizens are eligible for a visa-on-arrival at any point of entry.

AE.notes: Electronic visa available to passengers boarding Emirates or Etihad flight(s)

GB.notes:
24-hours visa-free visit:
when in transit to/from Australia, Canada, New Zealand or USA,
or if holder of residence permit issued by Australia, Canada, New Zealand or USA,
or if holder of certain EEA or Switzerland visas,
or if holder of certain Irish visas.

VU.notes: A maximum of 30 days of stay for visitors, extendable up to 4 months at the Vanuatu Immigration.

YE.notes: As of April 2016, due to safety concerns, Indonesian government advises its citizens not to visit Yemen.
